adverbs.description: justly (comparative justlier or more justly, superlative justliest or most justly)

entries.meaning: In a just or fair manner; rightfully.
examples: His valor, wisdom, and justice made him justly popular, but caused him to be regarded with suspicion at Rome.

entries.meaning: With a just or fair use of language; with good reason, properly.
examples: But the city on the River Clyde can justly claim to have turned the tide.
